backgroundRationale: The Wind River Watershed Project is a multi-agency watershed-scale effort to restore wild Wind River steelhead through habitat restoration and a robust RM and E program.  Streamflow measurements on the Wind River are used to help manage juvenile traps, and to design and monitor habitat work in the drainage.

sampleDesigns.title: Operate and maintain Wind River Gage - US Forest Service (USFS): Wind River

objectives: Provide hourly streamflow data available in realtime.
keyAssumptions: Stream stage measurements can be used to approximate stream discharge using an established rating curve developed at the monitoring location.
dataHandlingConsiderations: Data are reported from a remotely operated data logger via GOES satellite
qualityControlConsiderations: Direct lowflow discharge measurements are completed each year to validate the rating curve
equipmentCleaningAndCalibration: Instrumentation is maintained and checked for operation 2-4 times per year
rolesAndResponsibilities: Instrumentation maintenance and data collection are contracted out
fieldScheduleNotes: Lowflow discharge measurements are made in September/October yearly to validate or update the rating curve for this site.
budgetConsiderations: We use an abandoned USGS gage house for equipment housing and security.
name: Discharge Measurement
